alert.note: Alert for Orange; Putnam (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 4:34PM EDT until July 09 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Upton has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Orange County in southeastern New York... Western Putnam County in southeastern New York... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 434 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Newburgh, Monroe, West Point, Cold Spring, New Windsor, Gardnertown, Harriman, Fahnestock State Park, Kiryas Joel, Putnam Valley, Woodbury, Washingtonville, Firthcliffe, Highland Falls, Vails Gate, Balmville, Cornwall On Hudson, Fort Montgomery, Highland Mills and Central Valley. This includes the following streams and drainages... Fishkill Creek, Annsville Creek, Indian Brook, Stillwater Brook, Crows Nest Brook, Mineral Spring Brook, Wappinger Creek, Silver Stream, Wiccopee Creek, Queensboro Brook, Hudson River, Peekskill Hollow Creek, Wawayanda Creek, Ramapo River, Stony Brook, Baby Brook, Black Meadow Creek, West Branch Croton River, Lake Tiorati Brook, Trout Brook, Sand Spring Brook, Arden Brook and Canopus Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
